conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram to understand the processes involved.
The image shows a p-V diagram with four labeled points: O, a, b, c, and d. It includes two adiabatic processes (a to b and c to d) and two isochoric processes (b to c and d to a).
The internal energy of an ideal gas depends on its temperature.
For adiabatic processes, the temperature changes, affecting the internal energy.
For isochoric processes, the volume is constant, and thus the temperature remains constant.
The isochoric processes (b to c and d to a) occur at constant volume, meaning the internal energy does not change.
Since the internal energy is constant during isochoric processes, the internal energy at state a is the same as at state c.
The internal energy at state a is equal to the internal energy at state c.
